metadata.title: The White House Pro-Am
metadata.writer: Lawrence O'Donnell Jr. & Paul Redford and Aaron Sorkin
metadata.time_reference: Contemporary United States, during Bartlet administration

special_features: Commentary by the creator and writers

notes: This episode explores themes of political agendas and personal relationships within the White House.
The First Lady's activism creates tension with the President's administration.

in_universe_mythology: The Children's Crusade - a campaign against child labor.
real_world_cultural_references: Federal Reserve and its chairman's influence on economy.
individuals: Ron Erlich - Chairman of the Federal Reserve.

continuity_notes: Directly follows the episode '20 Hours in L.A.' and sets the stage for subsequent conflicts regarding the administration's public image.

plot.plot_summary: The President and the First Lady's staffs clash over differing priorities when Abigail Bartlet's comments on child labor spark legislative trouble. Meanwhile, tensions arise as Zoey Bartlet faces challenges in her relationship with Charlie Young due to security concerns.
